3DCE6985A861442CA54D1BAFB0DA6822.description: ESOLII.F.40: acquire and use general academic and domain-specific words and phrases appropriate for proficiency level with increasing precision

288C3B7B39C74720A2AAF0D5562BA450.description: ESOLII.F.39.c: differentiate between connotations (associations) and denotations (definitions) (e.g., stingy, scrimping, economical, wasteful, thrifty)

30BDFC925F0E4812B0DAB26DB2367291.description: ESOLII.F.39.b: use the relationship between particular words (e.g., cause/effect, part/whole, item/category) to better understand each of the words

A67369960E5D4ED59588F21802F855D6.description: ESOLII.F.39.a: interpret figures of speech (e.g., personification) in context

4517E80B4DC941468E0D0D144B259B97.description: ESOLII.F.39: demonstrate understanding of figurative language

26BC88FD1FA64A90BC56A4F040B6C110.description: ESOLII.F.38.c: consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning or its part of speech

F865DDC5AAA9432EA1300E7A14ADA9F3.description: ESOLII.F.38.b: use a knowledge of prefixes, suffixes, and root words to determine the meaning of a word

E3762847D8F34F67BBD2A7536D3212D3.description: ESOLII.F.38.a: use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph, a word’s position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase

EB391DBC86AE4EB9A1A559CEA353F8C2.description: ESOLII.F.38: determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases, reading and content, as appropriate to the students’ proficiency level

02F6DC6028774E818E25F2DE0350D6CE.description: ESOLII.E.37.b: maintain consistency in style and tone by the end of the school year

CF2367C2321B4225AA6B21250D776B1F.description: ESOLII.E.37.a: use varying sentence types for meaning, reader/listener interest, and style

DE7F1EA436CC40A8892291E8C4F00157.description: ESOLII.E.37: use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening

34E1C21F504148818102226B29B3537B.description: ESOLII.E.36.b: spell correctly, using dictionaries or technology for assistance as needed

C4C813C3F48A43AEB3D96A5DAE874EC3.description: ESOLII.E.36.a: use punctuation (e.g., periods, commas, quotation marks)

C3A4BD397E934B929C59C8355727FE43.description: ESOLII.E.36: demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing

4813A14B83FB44FABAA4248F40412441.description: ESOLII.E.35.d: recognize variations from standard English in their own and others’ writing and speaking

E262C853C7CA492D9F8D3B4B669C4A6B.description: ESOLII.E.35.c: recognize and correct incorrect subject-verb agreement

C9113D6ABB08475A952801D52BDE1904.description: ESOLII.E.35.b: recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in pronoun number and person

7D1978EC6D194D40BBADC7D564B4DF77.description: ESOLII.E.35.a: use subjective and objective pronouns with accuracy in most situations

38A72B64DAC94586AAFD8B5B1D7163EA.description: ESOLII.E.35: demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking

C455051B8DF74B9E836544C818035775.description: ESOLII.D.34: include multimedia components (e.g., graphics, images, music, sound) and visual displays in presentations to convey information

A983A2F721D24E0F99424A93DB568899.description: ESOLII.D.33: utilize formal and informal language as appropriate for audience and context

B096540EEA7C43878BFECB82503E0D88.description: ESOLII.D.32: present claims and findings, sequencing ideas logically, and using descriptions, facts, and details; use appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear and correct pronunciation

65F9151338CF49869D465138AE19D1AD.description: ESOLII.D.31: examine texts to determine the difference between fact and opinion

9D97B9B243C4433DBBFFD83AE52E8632.description: ESOLII.D.30: interpret information presented in diverse media and formats

5DAB0151D2464D918EFEC36285A06B10.description: ESOLII.D.29: plan and deliver oral presentations and reports on a variety of appropriate topics

E9EC9EE156E04BC3BB448E4B177271FF.description: ESOLII.D.28.d: review the key ideas expressed and demonstrate understanding of multiple perspectives

EC4E35AD209343DA98D0BAD4727BB2A7.description: ESOLII.D.28.c: pose and respond to specific questions with detail by making comments that contribute to the topic, text, or issue under discussion

35F94A6986614B7C855C655A144412DB.description: ESOLII.D.28.b: follow classroom norms during class discussions

11436339B3FC424AAE0F75DF361EE650.description: ESOLII.D.28.a: come to discussions prepared, having read or studied required material; refer to evidence on the topic, text, or issue and reflect on ideas under discussion

8BDCE10947CE458DB40012EFDBEA761D.description: ESOLII.D.28: engage in a range of collaborative discussions (e.g., one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on topics, texts, and issues, building on others' ideas and expressing their own

BE17003332F54A2BA31181EBFCB6758E.description: ESOLII.C.27: produce expository, persuasive, and/or narrative writing of varying lengths (sentences and paragraphs) for appropriate discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences

D350458424C344448CEBA9044CC46D34.description: ESOLII.C.26.b: evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, distinguishing claims that are supported by reasons and evidence from claims that are not

D8D40C1CB08F4E7F83A12C0FBA03D114.description: ESOLII.C.26.a: compare and contrast texts in different forms or genres (e.g., stories and poems; historical novels and fantasy stories) in terms of their approaches to similar themes and topics

CE1EFDA05B6B45C8AD0745CD2CAA22D6.description: ESOLII.C.26: draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research

915597A73A7F457193A122DBFC3062F7.description: ESOLII.C.25: gather relevant information from a limited number of print and digital sources appropriate to the students’ proficiency level; assess the credibility of each source; quote and cite the data and conclusions of others appropriately

51B4A5CD77D043CD9B693FB1DAD1224B.description: ESOLII.C.24: develop and strengthen writing through collaboration, guidance, and support from peers and adults, by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach

DCAA1A31228941FBBAB7B20F7FB4B214.description: ESOLII.C.23: conduct short research projects to answer questions, drawing on several sources and refocusing the inquiries when appropriate

8D9ADFFA7DE540919D95F915062AF225.description: ESOLII.C.22: produce paragraphs with varying sentence types (e.g., simple, compound) with increasing cohesion in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience

2EE351259D904DFF8F457473578EB0B3.description: ESOLII.C.21.e: provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events

C769C86FA67D451C8F2254C113112784.description: ESOLII.C.21.d: use precise words and phrases and relevant descriptive details to convey experiences and events

272EB8BE0B024222AF274BBF1714A34B.description: ESOLII.C.21.c: use transition words and phrases to convey sequence

948AFFD08FB54764998488DA6C3CEF15.description: ESOLII.C.21.b: use narrative techniques, such as dialogue and description, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters

3C8E21A304254D3DA31B2BB253AE2311.description: ESOLII.C.21.a: engage the reader by establishing a context and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence

46B8D82652ED4ED0A8C805A5A4BE172C.description: ESOLII.C.21: write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences

323DD30548A842368E54529EBB696B7E.description: ESOLII.C.20.h: provide a concluding sentence or statement that follows from the information or explanation presented

0764FFCA8BB049CBAE1637686C1B2DDD.description: ESOLII.C.20.g: identify and begin to use formal writing style

A92B06D22A2B46B59196EC968A00B089.description: ESOLII.C.20.f: read, comprehend, and explain documents that clarify details or support claims

4A01E12DD03E48779B9593D851F8BB28.description: ESOLII.C.20.e: use language and domain-specific vocabulary with increasing precision, appropriate to the students’ proficiency level to inform about or explain the topic

C6E90BCCAFD540E7986527E1332B8F46.description: ESOLII.C.20.d: use transitions to clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts

BDD234A29526415393FA5AE2BC0647E9.description: ESOLII.C.20.c: develop the topic with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples

B4181B46038B4D5F858EC32B11D4B68F.description: ESOLII.C.20.b: incorporate multimedia to aid comprehension

5A4B926756294AA6A0DC894F578E8AC0.description: ESOLII.C.20.a: introduce a topic; organize ideas, concepts, and information, using strategies such as definition, classification, comparison/contrast, and cause/effect

5DE14FFA11DF40E38F7E3DF566E8DE73.description: ESOLII.C.20: write an informative/explanatory paragraph on a topic and convey ideas and information by selecting, analyzing, and organizing relevant content

93CB6104A55C4735A341A062CE2D4054.description: ESOLII.C.19.d: provide a concluding sentence or statement that follows from the argument presented

7FDBEE29250B4B9A82F7F70C37F91713.description: ESOLII.C.19.c: use written English words, phrases, and clauses to clarify the relationships among claim(s) and reasons with increasing accuracy

1EF77481CCE0466DA75602681F139E43.description: ESOLII.C.19.b: support claim(s) with reasons and evidence, identifying credible sources and demonstrating an understanding of the topic or text

13CAB7C1444E4C6E8801F725BF2EF975.description: ESOLII.C.19.a: introduce claim(s) and organize the reasons and evidence

34608D6C7FD14FD5866A536F83AB6E56.description: ESOLII.C.19: write arguments to support claims with logical reasons and evidence

28447D8636D84F71B842FF165498AB1B.description: ESOLII.C.18: use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others; demonstrate sufficient command of keyboarding skills

57CEC3564CF64B72951294B7FB0C875D.description: ESOLII.B.17: read and comprehend literary nonfiction at the appropriate proficiency level

D428991A88364238A98DCBEA4843BACB.description: ESOLII.B.16: trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, distinguishing claims that are supported by reasons and evidence from claims that are not

75952294EEF946C584821B7798B60285.description: ESOLII.B.15: integrate information presented in different media or formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively) as well as in words to develop a coherent understanding of a topic or issue

C0B6A5E95ED2426F8E36F0A86886DEAD.description: ESOLII.B.14: determine an author’s point of view or purpose in a text

AC6729565B6D403EAB63A875025DA1E8.description: ESOLII.B.13: analyze how a particular sentence, paragraph, chapter, or section fits into the overall structure of a text and contributes to the development of the ideas

601B36270D4D4BCE88917290DD86E769.description: ESOLII.B.12.b: determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings

BD193D968D9744FA9C0A41EC347D0784.description: ESOLII.B.12.a: analyze in detail how a key individual, event, or idea is introduced, illustrated, and elaborated in a text (e.g., through examples or anecdotes)

40328E66EE004B79B73A3792D527E3D0.description: ESOLII.B.12: cite textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text

50A7B48C60FA40578CD975D8E43DA791.description: ESOLII.B.12: cite textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text

6A4B614EB75C4CE7B4CF847FDBDA4CA3.description: ESOLII.B.11: determine a central idea of a text and how it is conveyed through particular details; provide a summary of the text distinct from personal opinions or judgments

2F4C02C1DF57423DA9394306A893AF54.description: ESOLII.A.10: compare and contrast the experience of reading a story, drama, or poem to listening to or viewing an audio, video, or live version of the text

D8AED78D5E9A49DEA8BFD77DE2531C84.description: ESOLII.A.9: compare and contrast texts in different forms or genres (e.g., stories and poems, historical novels, fantasy stories, and traditional literature from different cultures) in terms of their approaches to similar themes and topics

85D3CE142C6B4B9684EF90E0A2F5C047.description: ESOLII.A.8: compare and contrast elements of poetry from cultural, linguistic, and historical perspectives

379F33004DC8456984BB466BBF863DE4.description: ESOLII.A.7: read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poems at the appropriate proficiency level, with teacher or peer guidance, collaboration, and/or scaffolding as needed

F3E7A8CC5F2F44C7ABD1494206CF0962.description: ESOLII.A.6: determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings

D0E4EB3A81D64C65AF6EB831C08664BD.description: ESOLII.A.5: analyze how a particular sentence, chapter, scene, or stanza fits into the overall structure of a text and contributes to the development of the theme, setting, or plot

9DDB1DE6B3444A15A64A910B7F13AC12.description: ESOLII.A.4: identify first- and third-person point of view and provide details to support

FCD85C18C18D45A78102BADB64E69F79.description: ESOLII.A.3: describe how a particular story’s or drama’s plot unfolds in a series of episodes as well as how the characters respond or change as the plot moves toward a resolution

34E13591AB09415299CCDB19A1EAB977.description: ESOLII.A.2: determine a theme and/or central idea of a text and how it is conveyed; provide a summary of the text

2AB011E0775641FB87661328F47958BC.description: ESOLII.A.1: cite textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as work toward making inferences drawn from the text
